Steps.Name: Power back on

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: To provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, we carry out regular inspections of our equipment in your area. This has identified cables and 6 poles that need replacing and upgrading. We will also be replacing stay wires and transferring service cables to the new poles. Doing this will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future as we appreciate your area has been impacted with unplanned power cuts in the last 6 months. To complete the work safely, we need to turn your power off to upgrade the equipment. To ensure the power is off for the shortest possible time, our contractors may carry out preparation works prior to the power cut. This work is taking place in Cooks Drove. A road closure will be in place to allow the work to be carried out safely. Access to your property will always be provided.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Talie at 22:14 - I'm pleased to confirm that all power in the Danescroft Drive SS9 4 area should be back on. The issue was caused by an unexpected underground cable fault, which our engineers excavated down to and diverted power around.

We know that a power cut can be difficult, and I'm sorry for the length of the time you were without your electricity. Please rest assured that our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Hi its David again. I'm so sorry your power has now been off for several hours and we're working as quickly as possible to get you back on.

We know you may be concerned about your phone battery running low, so here are some tips on how you can prolong battery life: Set your phone to power saving mode, reduce screen brightness, turn off WiFi, Bluetooth and GPS (if not in use), cut apps running in the background and if possible top up using a car charger or portable battery pack.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by David at 20:38 - Hi it's David here again. I'm so sorry that you are still without power this evening. I just wanted to give you the latest update. Our engineers have advised that they have instructed the digging team to carry out excavating another hole in the ground so we can carry on repairs to the faulty underground electrical equipment and restore the remaining properties without power. At the moment we don't need to change the estimated timeframe.

If you have a vulnerable person at home, please call us on 08003163105 and we'll see if we can provide any additional support.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Decasta at 11:39 - Thanks for your patience today. Our engineers have let us know that they have isolated power following reports of a grounded overhead cable. They have investigated the grounded cable, and have deemed it safe to restore power back to all but 2 properties in the IP10 0 and IP11 0 area.

We're very sorry we had to turn your power off unexpectedly, and with so little warning. We usually provide much more notice if we can, but in a situation like this our first priority is the safety of the public and our staff.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. If your power is still off or if you have any questions, call our team on 08003163105.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
What will happen next?

This outage affects multiple areas, so locations we mention may be further away than you expect. We're arranging staff to attend ASAP, but at the same time we try to restore power remotely by redirecting electricity. It's possible your power may go on and off as we try to get as many customers back on as we can.

Once available, our engineer will head to the local substation and after checking the network, they will attempt to restore more power from there. If unsuccessful, they will work to locate the issue and make repairs, which may take longer to get the lights on.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing but we'll always give you the clearest information we have.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Sent by Simon at 10:36 - Thank you for your patience while our engineers connected the temporary generators on the underground network in the Pouchen End Lane area, we've now restored power to most of the affected properties. There are now only 3 properties without power, who we'll speak to directly. If you're without power and haven't been contacted, then we'll need to hear from you. Please call us on 08003163105 (free from landlines and mobiles).

Winter is here and temperatures are low, so we understand that it can be very concerning to have a power cut as this may have affected your heating.

Should you have a gas hob, you may be able to carefully ignite it with matches or a lighter in order for you to warm up with a hot drink or meal. Please only attempt this if you are confident it can be done safely.

If you have someone in the property who may be more vulnerable to the cold please do not hesitate to call us free on 105.

We will do our best to provide additional care and support whilst work continues to get your power back on ASAP.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Aaron at 13:55 - Thank you for your patience while our engineers made repairs to the underground network in the Redehall Road area. We have now restored power to all but one property. We're sorry for any disruption this unexpected power cut caused.

If your power isn't back on, we'd still like to keep you updated. If we aren't currently in contact with you by phone or in person at your property, please call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Aaron at 13:16 - Thanks for your patience over today.

Our engineers have let us know that their repairs are taking longer than anticipated. To give them time to do this safely, the estimated time frame to restore your power is now between 15:00 and 16:00.

We're sorry this is taking longer than expected, and we'll continue to keep you up to date, but if any change to this time comes in from our staff I'll let you know as soon as we hear.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Aaron at 13:33 - Our engineers have restored power to all 224 properties in the CT3 4/CT7 0 area, and we're pleased that this is sooner than we estimated. They have diverted power around the fault to restore supplies.

We know some properties in the area may have faced other recent interruptions, and we're sorry for the extra disruption. Every outage is fully investigated by our engineers, though power may be lost several times before we can safely find and fix the issue. Our customer services team will keep as many customers updated as possible during these investigations. 

We're sorry for the unplanned disruption. If you need to talk to us, or let us know that your power isn't restored, call us on 08003163105.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our engineers have arrived on site in the CT3 4/CT7 0 area to investigate the power cut affecting 224 properties.

Specialist engineers are also working to divert power remotely, and this can cause your lights to go on and off.

We know that a power cut can be very disruptive; we understand this can greatly impact your daily activities and we want to support you however we can. We'll update you with all of our progress but if you need to speak to us, call our team on 08003163105 any time. Sent by Aaron at 13:00.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Aaron at 12:26 - Our engineers are on their way. At this point we think the issue is an overhead network fault affecting 224 properties.

Specialist engineers from our control room are also working to divert power remotely, so it's possible your power could come back on at any point. We can't always restore everyone this way. That's why we're also sending staff to the area to check our equipment.

Every fault is different, so our time frames have to be estimated but currently we hope to have power back on between 15:30 and 16:30. We must stress that it may become necessary for this to change, depending on what our engineers find.

We'll keep you updated with our progress.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Decasta at 15:09 - We can now confirm that all power in the area should be back on. Our engineers had to unexpectedly turn off the power to 82 customers in the Sevenoaks TN15 6 area to safely repair a fault on the network.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Hi there. We've just had a shift change, so Decasta, Lee, Adam and Will are now here to keep you updated with progress from our field teams.

We know it's frustrating being without power, but we wanted to assure you we're still here and as soon as we have some more information we'll update you again.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Sent by Decasta at 15:43 - Our engineers have now restored power to all 428 customers in the Woodham Park Road area, by diverting power around an overhead cabling fault.  We know a power cut can be difficult; we're sorry for any disruption this unplanned power cut caused.  

We know some properties in the area may have faced other recent interruptions, and we're sorry for the extra disruption. Every outage is fully investigated by our engineers, though power may be lost several times before we can safely find and fix the issue. Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Decasta at 14:26 - Thanks for your patience this afternoon.

Our staff are checking our equipment throughout the area to pinpoint the issue on our overhead cabling network. In addition to this, they are liaising closely with our control room to find safe and reliable ways to divert power around any problems and get everyone restored.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them. We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.

Steps.Message: Hi, I'm Ebony and I'm the manager of the text messaging team at UK Power Networks. The power cut was caused by a cable being damaged by another company; with safety in mind, we had to turn off power to 294 properties, I'm sorry that we weren't able to provide you with prior notice. I'm pleased to say our staff have now diverted the power around the network to get your lights back on as soon as possible We contact customers when we are made aware of problems like this, so if you would like to be notified in future let us know here https://bit.ly/3zyHC6L I'm sorry for the disruption this caused you. We aim to provide a 10/10 service in keeping you updated, so if you'd like to talk to us about anything or are still without power, please call us on 105
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Lee at 16:06 - We can now confirm that all power in the area should be back on. Our engineers had to unexpectedly turn off the power to 294 customers in the Queen Caroline Street, W6 9 area for public safety as a cable was damaged by another company near a school.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Lee at 15:10 - We're very sorry we've had to switch off your electricity. If you'd like more information about why we sometimes have to switch power off to work; here's a short video https://bit.ly/3cYez0V. We'll keep you updated with progress.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Lee at 17:56 - We can now confirm that all power in the E8 2, N16 8 area should be back on.

Our staff are trying to find the root cause and fix it permanently, however with this kind of issue it's likely that power will go off multiple times before we're able to find and fix it. For now we have restored your power as quickly as we can.

If your power isn't on or you would like to talk to us, call us for free on 08003163105. We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our staff have now arrived on site in the E8 2, N16 8 area. They will start running tests at our substation to see how the local network is operating.

It's quite common for power to be restored briefly and go off again; this is our engineers using testing equipment to energise different sections of our network - this helps to narrow down any possible issues.

Our cabling network is often broken down by smaller sites, and our staff may also check these to test for any problems, and they may also walk the cabling route to see if there are any signs of malfunction that have appeared on the surface. Our time frame hasn't been adjusted, so for now I'll let you know more news as soon as our staff update us.

Sent by Lee at 17:42.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Lee at 16:13 - Our staff are on the way to the E8 2, N16 8 area, and our estimated time frame to have power back on is currently between 1900 - 2000. However, this could change once our staff have assessed the local network.

We believe the power cuts you have been experiencing are caused by a fault with one of the cables. Developing faults can start very small, and so can be hard to detect but each power cut usually makes it easier to see, which means our specialist staff can detect it, and work on the repair to prevent further outages.

I'll let you know once our teams arrive.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Adam at 20:19 - We believe our engineers have been able to restore power to all 3443 customers in the Edgware, HA8 area, by diverting power around the overhead network fault. We understand how difficult a power cut can be, we're sorry for any disruption or worry this unplanned power cut caused you.   

If your power isn't back on we'll need to hear from you. To report this, or to talk to us about anything else, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be worrying, but please rest assured that our staff work around the clock to keep the lights on. If you have any concerns or questions, give us a call any time.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our engineers have arrived on site in the Edgware, HA8 area to investigate the power cut affecting 172 properties.

Specialist engineers are also working to divert power remotely, and this can cause your lights to go on and off.

We know that a power cut can be very disruptive; we understand this can greatly impact your daily activities and we want to support you however we can. We'll update you with all of our progress but if you need to speak to us, call our team on 08003163105 any time. Sent by Adam at 19:39.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Adam at 19:17 - Our engineers are on their way. We believe the issue is an underground network fault that initially interrupted power to 3443 properties. However, we have managed to divert power back to some properties, so 172 properties are still affected. Specialist engineers from our control room will continue to divert power remotely, so your power may come back on at any point. Sometimes we can't restore everyone this way, so we're also sending staff to check our equipment. We're currently estimating power will be on between 20:30-21:30, but this may change depending on what our staff find. Power back on? To stop receiving texts, follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe. Otherwise, we'll keep you updated.

Steps.Message: Hi, I'm Steph and I'm the manager of the text messaging team at UK Power Networks. Today's power cut was caused by an unexpected low hanging overhead cable; with safety in mind, we had to turn off power to 864 properties, so I'm sorry that we weren't able to provide you with prior notice. I'm pleased to say our staff have now repaired this to get your lights back on as soon as possible. We contact customers when we are made aware of problems like this, so if you would like to be notified in future let us know here https://bit.ly/3zyHC6L I personally apologise for the disruption this caused you. We aim to provide a 10/10 service in keeping you updated, so if you'd like to talk to us about anything or are still without power, please call us on 105.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

We're sorry for the unplanned disruption. If you need to talk to us, or let us know that your power isn't restored, call us on 08003163105.

I appreciate your continued patience this morning. I know having power cuts as often as this must be very disruptive, and our staff are doing everything they can to get this resolved.

Steps.Message:
Our staff have now arrived on site in the Cecil Avenue area. They will start running tests at our substation to see how the local network is operating.

It's quite common for power to be restored briefly and go off again; this is our engineers using testing equipment to energise different sections of our network - this helps to narrow down any possible issues.

Our cabling network is often broken down by smaller sites, and our staff may also check these to test for any problems, and they may also walk the cabling route to see if there are any signs of malfunction that have appeared on the surface. Our time frame hasn't been adjusted, so for now I'll let you know more news as soon as our staff update us.

Steps.Message:
What will happen next?

This outage is affecting multiple areas, so locations we mention may be further away than you'd expect. We have already sent staff to the area, but at the same time we try to restore power remotely by redirecting the electricity around the faulty section. It's possible your power may go on and off as we try to restore as much power as we can.

The engineer will head to the local substation and after checking the network, will attempt to restore more power from there. If unsuccessful, they will locate and repair the issue, which will take longer to get the lights on.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing, but we'll always try to give you the clearest information we have.
